      • setCursor

        protected void setCursor(java.awt.Component content,
                         java.awt.Cursor cursor)
        Sets the specified cursor for the specified content. It can be overridden if another approach is used. Note: default implementation takes Component.getTreeLock()

      • setBounds

        protected void setBounds(java.awt.Component comp,
                         java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
        Note: default implementation takes Component.getTreeLock()

      • isDisabled

        protected boolean isDisabled(java.awt.Component view)
        Parameters:
        view - the component to move/resize
        Returns:
        true if the specified component cannot be moved/resized, or false otherwise

      • setCursorType

        protected void setCursorType(int cursorType)

      • getContent

        protected java.awt.Component getContent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
        Returns a window content which is used to find corresponding window and to set a cursor. By default, it returns a component from the specified mouse event if the content is not specified.

      • getView

        protected java.awt.Component getView(java.awt.Component component)
        Finds a movable/resizable view for the specified content. By default, it returns the first window ancestor. It can be overridden to return something else, for example, a layered component.

      • isBusy

        public boolean isBusy()
        Returns true if a window is now moving/resizing.

      • notifyMoved

        protected void notifyMoved()

      • notifyResized

        protected void notifyResized()
